title: Nadler: 'There was in plain sight open collusion'
content:
Jared Corey Kushner The high price for supporting Bibi Netanyahu Speaker in waiting? Rapid rise of Hakeem Jeffries fuels talk Stephen Miller's influence rising amid changes at DHS MORE ’s 2016 Trump Tower meeting with Russian associates allegedly indicates “there was in plain sight open collusion with the Russians,” Nadler said on CBS’ “Face The Nation.”
Mueller last month concluded his investigation into Russia interference in the 2016 election and possible collusion between Trump's campaign and Moscow. He did not find evidence of cooperation between Trump's campaign and Russia, according to a four-page summary of his findings provided to Congress by Attorney General William Barr William Pelham Barr The Hill's 12:30 Report: Barr says there was 'spying' on Trump campaign Finally united, House Republicans refer ex-Trump lawyer Michael Cohen for perjury prosecution Fox News legal analyst: 'There must be some evidence' of criminal activity in Mueller report MORE .
Noting that Mueller also reportedly made no determination on obstruction of justice, Nadler called Barr “a biased person” who primary serves the interests of the White House. House Judiciary Chairman @RepJerryNadler says in the Mueller report: “There could be grounds for impeachment, there could be grounds for other actions, there could be things the American people ought to know.” pic.twitter.com/MUngvGoL1s — Face The Nation (@FaceTheNation) April 7, 2019 ADVERTISEMENT
The full Mueller report has yet to be released and Nadler said Barr should redact “none of” the Mueller report before delivering it to the Judiciary Committee. He expressed confidence that information would not leak to the public.
"The committee has a very good record of protecting information which it decides to protect,” he said.
He also addressed claims he opposed the release of similar findings by Special Prosecutor Kenneth Starr in 1998 after his investigation of then-President Bill Clinton William (Bill) Jefferson Clinton Gillibrand: Hillary Clinton 'still a role model' but 'my views on her husband' are different Twitter disables video with 'Dark Knight' music Trump shared Warner Bros files copyright claim after Trump shares video with music from 'Dark Knight' MORE .
Calling the comparison “apples and oranges,” Nadler said his remarks on the Starr report concerned the release of grand jury information to the public rather than to Congress.
Nadler did not take a position on whether the full Mueller report could contain grounds for impeachment, saying “there could be grounds for impeachment, there could be grounds for other actions, there could be things the American people ought to know.”

title: Kirk: Trump Free Speech Order Already Working to Protect Students
content:
Never said to send your kid to private school either. Some may be just as bad. Ultimately homeschooling is likely the best option for most people in most places. Who knows your kid, and more importantly cares about your kid and his or her education, more than you do? There’s only one way to make sure your kids are learning the right things, and not the wrong things, and that’s to spend time with them and educate them yourself. Talk to them daily about the stuff they hear from other people or the media. Like I said it may take some sacrifices. Cut back on work hours between you and your spouse, cut back on other things you’d spend your money on if you both worked. It’ll be worth it in the end. Like I said, kids need their parents more than they need money.
Having gone to college myself, I would strongly encourage my own kids to go to a technical school or a trade school instead, or to start their own business. College funds started by parents when their kids are little might be better spent as seed money to start a new business, if the kid has an entrepreneurial spirit, or as a down payment on a house for their kid who chose to go into a trade. Everyone should consider college as only one of many possible paths to success, and not even a particularly good one. Going into debt for a college degree is pure insanity.

Whenever the Communists infect a system it goes through these stages:
1. Switch the message to their insanity
2. Corrupt it
3. Rob it blind
4. Leave it disrespected or dead
Destroying Western Institutions is a major part of their effort.
They corrupt a system, then declare it broken.

title: Kirk: Trump Free Speech Order Already Working to Protect Students
content:
"b) everything to do with the fact that some colleges keep their faculty busy."
Most faculty don't teach but a few classes. Graduate students and teaching fellows do a lot of the grunt work - teaching small classes, grading papers and tests, as I did. That leaves a lot of time for writing, conferences, et.al . And more time these days for activism.

title: Kirk: Trump Free Speech Order Already Working to Protect Students
content:

No Democrat is better, no RINO is better, so regardless of what Trump doesn’t do even if he said he would, he is the best for the job. Otherwise, this EO as well as the border wall, tax reductions, health care etc will all return to the hands of the global, fascist socialists.
This is not rocket science: every conservative must vote in which it is the duty of involved conservatives to motivate uninvolved conservatives.
If you can’t do all you can do, really do, then you lose your right to complain when Trump’s accomplishments are reversed. And they will be, immediately at their first opportunity.
